Tak Mau Hadiri KLB PSSI, La Nyalla: Kalau Terus, Ditertawai Orang
01 Nov 2019, 09:22 by Antara, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - La Nyalla Mattalitti memastikan tak akan hadir saat kongres Persatuan Sepak Bola Seluruh Indonesia (PSSI) pemilihan Komite Eksekutif (Exco) periode 2019-2023, ketua umum dan wakil ketua umum yang digelar pada 2 November 2019.
"Saya sudah sampaikan, selama kongres digelar 2 November maka saya menarik diri," ujarnya di sela kunjungannya di Gedung Negara Grahadi di Surabaya, Jumat.
Alasannya, kata dia, karena penyelenggaraan kongres pada tanggal tersebut dianggapnya tidak betul sehingga tak akan menghadirinya. "Kalau saya teruskan maka saya bisa ditertawai orang, apalagi saya mantan ketua umum. Jadi tidak mungkin (hadir)," ucap pria yang juga Ketua DPD RI tersebut.
Menurut mantan ketua PSSI ini, jika kongres pelaksanaan kongres digelar pada Januari 2020 maka ia memastikan mendukung dan hadir. "Aturannya harusnya waktu Januari itu, dan saya baru mau mencalonkan. Tapi rupanya tetap berjalan 2 November, jadi mari dilihat saja besok hasilnya," kata La Nyalla.
Sementara itu, PSSI tetap menyelenggarakan kongres pada 2 November untuk memilih komite eksekutif beserta anggotanya, termasuk ketua umum, wakil ketua umum di Jakarta.
Pelaksana Tugas Ketua Umum PSSI Iwan Budianto menegaskan jadwal tersebut telah disepakati oleh pemilik suara pada kongres luar biasa akhir Juli lalu.
Kongres PSSI pada 2 November 2019 diikuti oleh 86 voter PSSI yang terlibat dalam kongres luar biasa (KLB) PSSI pada Juli 2019. Voter tersebut terdiri atas 34 asosiasi provinsi (Asprov), 18 klub Liga 1, 16 klub Liga 2, 16 klub Liga 3, Asosiasi Futsal dan Asosiasi Sepak bola wanita.
PSSI juga menegaskan kongres tersebut sah dan legal karena sesuai statuta PSSI 2019 serta didukung oleh federasi internasional sepak bola, FIFA. Sebagai bentuk dukungan, FIFA dan AFC memastikan akan menghadiri kongres tersebut melalui perwakilan masing-masing.
La Nyalla merupakan satu dari 11 calon ketua umum PSSI periode 2019-2023 yang telah ditetapkan Komisi Pemilihan. Calon lainnya adalah Arif Wicaksono, Aven Hinelo, Bernhard Limbong, Benny Erwin, Fary Djemy Francis, Mochamad Iriawan, Rahim Soekasah, Sarman El Hakim, Vijaya Fitriyasa, dan Yesayas Oktavianus

Do not Want to Attend PSSI KLB, La Nyalla: If Continue, Laughing at People
Nov 01 2019, 09:22 by Antara, Nurdin Saleh
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - La Nyalla Mattalitti confirmed that he would not be present during the All Indonesia Football Association (PSSI) congress for the 2019-2023 Executive Committee (Exco) election period, the general chairman and deputy chairman who were held on November 2, 2019.
"I have said, during the 2 November congress that was held that I withdrew," he said during his visit to the Grahadi State Building in Surabaya, Friday.
The reason, he said, was because the organization of the congress on that date was considered incorrect so that it would not attend. "If I continue then I can be laughed at by people, moreover I am a former chairman. So it is not possible (to be present)," said the man who is also the Chairman of the DPD RI.
According to the former PSSI chairman, if a congress was held in January 2020, he would be sure to support and attend. "The rules should be in January, and I just want to nominate. But apparently it still runs November 2, so let's just look at the results tomorrow," La Nyalla said.
Meanwhile, PSSI continued to hold a congress on November 2 to elect the executive committee and its members, including the general chairman, vice chairman in Jakarta.
Acting Chairperson of PSSI Chairman Iwan Budianto confirmed that the schedule had been agreed by the voters at the extraordinary congress at the end of July.
The PSSI Congress on 2 November 2019 was attended by 86 PSSI voters involved in the PSSI extraordinary congress (KLB) in July 2019. The voters consisted of 34 provincial associations (Asprov), 18 League 1 clubs, 16 League 2 clubs, 16 League 3 clubs , Futsal Association and Women's Football Association.
PSSI also stressed that the congress was legal and legal because it was in accordance with the 2019 PSSI statute and was supported by the international soccer federation, FIFA. As a form of support, FIFA and AFC made sure to attend the congress through their respective representatives.
La Nyalla is one of 11 PSSI general chairperson candidates for the 2019-2023 period determined by the Election Commission. Other candidates are Arif Wicaksono, Aven Hinelo, Bernhard Limbong, Benny Erwin, Fary Djemy Francis, Mochamad Iriawan, Rahim Soekasah, Sarman El Hakim, Vijaya Fitriyasa, and Yesayas Oktavianus
